subject: COMM
name: Hon: Public Speaking
info: Public communication processes, elements, and ethics. Criticism of and response to public discourse. Practice in individual speaking designed to encourage civic participation.prereq: Honors

subject: COMM
name: Hon: Intro/Communication
info: Verbal/nonverbal communication: public address, interpersonal, organizational, intercultural, electronic. Ways in which new communication technologies influence/are influenced by existing forms of communication.

subject: COMM
name: Hon: Analy of Argum
info: Strategies for analyzing, evaluating, generating arguments. Problems in listening/responding to argument.

subject: COMM
name: Honors Topics in Comm Studies
info: Cases illustrating communication studies, theory, underlying issues.prereq: Honors

subject: COMM
name: Honors: Research Seminar
fullname: Honors Course: Research Seminar in Communication
info:
Students conduct original research in rhetoric, communication theory, or media for honors thesis. Theory, methods, research writing.

prereq: Honors candidate in comm, instr consent, dept consent

subject: COMM
name: Honors: Intro Rhet Theory
info: Theoretical systems to explain/direct the creation of public discourse.  Traditional rhetoric to contemporary perspectives. Using theory to explain practice of public discourse.

subject: COMM
name: Hon: Basic Soc Stats
info: Descriptive statistics, including measures of central tendency, deviation, association. Inferential statistics, focusing on probability, hypothesis testing. T-tests, Chi-square tests, variance analysis, bivariate regression. Statistical software used to analyze sociological data.
